definition[0]: to sell goods at a lower price than someone else
definition[1]: to make other people think that someone or something is less good, effective, skilful etc than they really are
example[0]: I think he undersold himself at the interview.
definition[2]: to sell goods etc at a lower price than someone else
example[2]: They claim never to be undersold  (=that nobody sells goods as cheaply as they do).
definition[3]: to sell something for less than its real value
example[3]: When it was privatized, the water industry was massively undersold.
definition[4]: to make people think that a product or a person is less good, effective, skilful etc than they really are
example[4]: Donâ€™t undersell yourself at the interview.
